intro: Phyllostegia ovata, commonly known as the broad-leafed bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, pink to white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the summer months. Its stems are typically erect and can grow up to several feet in height. Phyllostegia ovata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
